body:
Do you have IPv6 configured for that machine? It seems not.
If it's not configured, you can remove that entry from the global discovery server list.

It's configured:

```
paulo@monk:~$ ifconfig eth0
eth0      Link encap:Ethernet  HWaddr 18:03:73:57:5e:e7  
          inet addr:192.168.25.3  Bcast:192.168.25.255  Mask:255.255.255.0
          inet6 addr: fe80::1a03:73ff:fe57:5ee7/64 Scope:Link
          UP BROADCAST RUNNING MULTICAST  MTU:1500  Metric:1
          RX packets:2551723 errors:0 dropped:0 overruns:0 frame:0
          TX packets:2768348 errors:0 dropped:0 overruns:0 carrier:0
          collisions:0 txqueuelen:1000 
          RX bytes:1716427840 (1.7 GB)  TX bytes:2454407193 (2.4 GB)
```

Most local connections between my laptop and my Android phone are done over IPv6.
You don't have any global IPv6 connectivity. The error is reasonable, but can be ignored in your case.

Oh, I see, it does make sense. I'm gonna remove that address from the announce list. 

Thanks for the explanation, @calmh.

I'm getting

```
[SUXRZ] 15:45:58 INFO: Error creating discovery client  Unsupported scheme:
```

twice, once after

```
[SUXRZ] 15:45:58 INFO: Starting global discovery announcements
```

and after

```
[SUXRZ] 15:46:10 INFO: New UPnP port mapping: external port 9558 to local port 22000.
```

I'm ignoring it as suggested, but it's missing

```
udp6://announce-v6.syncthing.net:22026
```

although it's in config. Is this expected?

Windows 7 64bit, syncthing 0.11.3

Getting it twice is expected, because the "descovery client" is restarted after setting UPnP.

You probably get the error because your internet connection does not support IPv6.

Thanks for info about "twice".

Yes, I don't have IPv6. But my error says

```
[SUXRZ] 15:45:58 INFO: Error creating discovery client  Unsupported scheme:
```

instead of

```
[SUXRZ] 15:45:58 INFO: Error creating discovery client udp6://announce-v6.syncthing.net:22026 Unsupported scheme:
```

Error with `udp6://announce-v6.syncthing.net:22026` says what is wrong and user then realise, that he has no IPv6 and ignore this, but error without address does not point to core of problem. From my perspective it's not by design, but I may be wrong, hence that question.
I tried to have this open, because the error sucks and should be fixed/clarified. We'll try again. :)

as a sidenote: I think upnp errors should not be presented in the notification window because it unnecessary alarms new users of minor technical problems. We should improve important notifications, e.g. when files cannot be created (https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/issues/1437) and reduce technical logging (such as this one).
Yes. Warning level should be reserved for serious stuff, that is both important and actionable by the user somehow...
I get this same message (Unsupported scheme), and I do actually have a global IPv6 address, running Arch Linux x86_64 here.
"Unsupported scheme" is a config error. What is the actual discovery server URL? It should start with either `udp://`, `udp4://` or `udp6://`.
It should have been the default, but I just peeked into the config.xml and it looks like a leading space was causing the issue; I removed it and it seems to work now.

issue.title: Inserts an erroneous space into globalAnnounceServer configuration

repository.name: syncthing-gtk
repository.description: GTK3 & python based GUI for Syncthing

issue.body:
On trying to figure out why syncthing/syncthing#1750 was even an issue for me, I seem to have traced it down to syncthing-gtk. When using the Daemon Settings dialog, it will resave the configuration for the global announce servers, and would often insert spaces at the beginning or end of announce server URLs, most often causing syncthing to report an unsupported URI scheme and the announce server will effectively be disabled.

For example, the config.xml for syncthing might appear as such after re-saving, causing the problem:

``` xml
        <globalAnnounceServer>udp4://announce.syncthing.net:22026</globalAnnounceServer>
        <globalAnnounceServer> udp6://announce-v6.syncthing.net:22026</globalAnnounceServer>
```
